once again under the hood it's mostly
just a fancy VR headset it has an M2
Chip built into the device along with a
new specially designed R1 chip that can
handle parallel processing for all of
the sensors it has extremely low latency
which is essential for not puking all
over yourself after using it for 10
minutes it's got cameras on the outside
and then eyeball trackers on the inside
what's really crazy is that it uses
something called foveated rendering
which means that it will maximize the
image quality based on where your eyes
are looking at that time it's kind of
like the double slit experiment if you
aren't looking directly at something
those frames are there but they're not
being rendered in addition you control
things with your eyeballs when you look
at icons they'll pop out at you then you
can pinch and swipe with your hand to
select and scroll it can also do voice
commands and even has a virtual keyboard
that's pretty crazy but they missed a
huge opportunity here to give this
